actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Friday, May 30, 2025,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Friday, May 30, 2025, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S. 1582 (Sen. Hagerty):
        A bill to provide for the regulation of payment stablecoins, and for other purposes.

        -- Considered by Senate.
 

 S.Amdt. 2228 (Sen. Ricketts):
        To provide for expedited certification of existing regulatory regimes.

        --Considered by Senate.


 S.Amdt. 2278 (Sen. Bennet):
        To provide a definition.

        --Amendment SA 2278 proposed by Senator Bennet to Amendment SA 2228.

PN12-33:
        James O'Neill, of California, to be Deputy Secretary of Health and Human Services

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN17:
        Michael Duffey, of Virginia, to be Under Secretary of Defense for Acquisition and Sustainment

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 45. Record Vote Number: 282 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 6/3/2025.


 PN55-9:
        Michelle Bowman, of Kansas, to be Vice Chairman for Supervision of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System for a term of four years

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN55-47:
        Edward Walsh, of New Jersey, to be Ambassador to Ireland

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
Under the authority of the order of today, at  6:50 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Ricketts in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
